references.paper_title: A+: Adjusted anchored neighborhood regression for fast super-resolution
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the TinyLUT approach because it introduced a fast super-resolution method based on regression which inspired the use of LUTs for efficient image restoration.

references.paper_title: Beyond a gaussian denoiser: Residual learning of deep cnn for image denoising
references.reason: This paper is highly influential because it advanced the use of deep convolutional neural networks (CNNs) for image denoising, a key technique that TinyLUT leverages and improves upon.

references.paper_title: Image Super-Resolution Using Deep Convolutional Networks
references.reason: This is a seminal work in deep learning-based super-resolution, providing a foundation for many subsequent works, including TinyLUT, which builds upon the concept of using deep CNNs for image restoration.

references.paper_title: Learning Series-Parallel Lookup Tables for Efficient Image Super-Resolution
references.reason: This paper is directly relevant to TinyLUT because it proposes a framework based on multiple LUTs for improved super-resolution, a concept that TinyLUT refines with its separable mapping strategy.

references.paper_title: Practical single-image super-resolution using look-up table
references.reason: This work directly inspired the TinyLUT authors; it is among the first to explore the use of LUTs for single image super-resolution, demonstrating the potential of this approach which TinyLUT significantly advances.
